example.name: extensionPhabricator
example.synopsis: How to use the Phabricator extension for WSForm to create / edit tasks in Phabricator
example.description:
Initialize WSform with extension="phabricator"


The extension looks for WSForm fields with the following names :

  • task-title
  • task-id
  • task-description
  • task-status
  • task-priority
  • task-project
  • task-subscriber

if you use task-id, the task with that id will be updated. Omit task-id and a new task will be created.

task-subscriber holds the names to users in Phabricator that will be subscribed to the task (seperate more than one user with a column-sign : "|")

task-project holds the name(s) or Id(s) of project(s) in Phabricator that will be tagged to this task (seperate more than one project with a column-sign : "|")
example.example:
Title of task

Description of task
example.note:
• Task status can have the following values : open, resolved, wontfix, invalid, spite
  • Task priority can have the following values : unbreak, triage, high, normal, low, wish
